{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents provided describe macrosomia as a condition characterized by birthweight equal to or greater than 4500 g. There is no mention of the gestational age at which this condition can be diagnosed. However, one study mentions ultrasound examination at 36 weeks' gestation, and another study refers to estimated fetal weight (EFW) exceeding 4000 g or the 90th percentile for gestational age at 36 or more weeks' gestation. There is no evidence in these studies that suggests severe macrosomia can be manifested at 11-14 weeks of gestation.", "answer_choice": B}
